com.mobius.vdrapi
Class ApiVerifier

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.mobius.vdrapi.ApiVerifier
public class ApiVerifier
extends Object

This class contains various tests you can perform on your application's configuration to verify that the system environment is set up correctly.

To perform these tests, call the verifyInstallation function following the initial configuration of your application.

You can obtain the results of the installation verification tests by calling get(), get (int) or getResult(int).

Method Detail

get

public static boolean get()
Returns the overall result of the verifyInstallation function.

Returns:
True if all the tests are passed, or False if any of the tests are failed.

get

public static boolean get(int test)
Returns the results of a specific test.

Parameters:
test - - the test for which you want the result.
Returns:
True if the test was passed, otherwise False.

getResult

public static ApiVerifierResult getResult(int test)
Returns additional information about a specific test.

Parameters:
test - - the test about which you would like more information.
Returns:
an ApiVerifierResult object type.

verifyInstallation

public static void verifyInstallation()
                               throws Throwable
Verifies that specific variables required by your application are set correctly. If it identifies errors, the function attempts to reset the incorrect paths, applying various possible paths that are typically employed.

Results are returned by calls to get() and get(int).

Throws:
Throwable - if it can not load the native libraries or if other unexpected errors occur.

verifyInstallation

public static void verifyInstallation(String profileFile)
                               throws Throwable
Verifies that specific variables required by your application are set correctly. If it identifies errors, the function attempts to reset the incorrect paths, applying various possible paths that are typically employed.

Results are returned by calls to get() and get(int).

Parameters:
profileFile - The name of the profile file to use (i.e. ddrint.xml)
Throws:
Throwable - if it can not load the native libraries or if other unexpected errors occur.
